headline: 7-10 days is ideal for most first safari experiences
summary: For first-time safari travelers, 7-10 days on the ground in Africa (including safari and any extensions) provides the ideal balance. This allows 5-7 days of actual safari, time to recover from jet lag, and possibly a beach or cultural extension. Shorter trips feel rushed; longer trips may experience diminishing returns on wildlife novelty.

assumptions.text: 1-2 days for jet lag recovery improves the overall safari experience.
After 7-8 days of safari, wildlife novelty begins to diminish for most travelers.
Beach or cultural extensions add variety to an Africa trip.

gains: Time for extensions without rushing safari
losses: May feel long for some travelers

change_conditions: If vacation time is limited, prioritize safari days over extensions.
If budget is fixed, 7 quality days may be better than 10 budget days.
If repeat visitor, longer or shorter trips may suit based on goals.
If combining specific activities (gorillas, beach), plan around those.
